page.title: 11AGRICULTURE AND ECOLOGY
page.content: There is constant discussion about modern farming methods,{ecology}and {conservation.}For economic reasons fields need to be bigger so trees and hedges are removed, this changes the {landscape}and provides fewer habitats for wild-life.{Foot paths}end up crossing fields, to the annoyance of both farmer and rambler.{Straw burning after harvest is still a problem. As there are no animals on the farms straw is no longer needed so only a small quantity is baled and sold. Most straw is burnt on the fields making large black clouds of smoke and ash that seems to penetrate even closed windows. No-one likes it. The farmers get rid of the straw quickly and kill off some weeds and diseases. Hedges and the odd house get burnt too. Chopping and ploughing in is being tried. Other uses are being sought.
